channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Why are Hindus in Bangladesh fearful ahead of February 12 elections?
Why a Japanese town has cancelled the cherry blossom festival
Is Nancy Guthrie alive? Unanswered questions 6 days after abduction of US journalist’s mother
Winter Olympic medals are worth much more than before. Here’s why
More Indians deported from Saudi Arabia than US in 2025. What we know so far
Why ‘secret’ Bangladesh-US trade deal has sparked concern
How US’ Pax Silica is India’s golden opportunity
item.description: The February 4 US-organised ministerial on critical minerals was less an endpoint than a beginning. For India, the participation reinforces its ambition to emerge as a key node in global technology and resource networks

item.title: From tariff to trust: How India and United States reset trade and ties
item.description: The India-US trade deal is a strategic reset that significantly lowers trade barriers for Indian exporters and strengthens the bilateral economic partnership

item.title: Kashmir Solidarity Day: How Pakistan is trying to mask its terror image post Operation Sindoor
item.description: The February 5 spectacle appears less like an expression of solidarity and more like a hurried and desperate attempt to recast a state widely known as the ‘mothership of terrorism’ into a self-styled champion of Kashmiri rights.

item.title: Beyond the N-bomb: China, not Russia, now haunts the West
item.description: The lapse of US-Russia nuclear pact is not an accident of war or politics; it reflects a deeper strategic shift with the rise of China. The new Cold War isn’t nuclear — it’s mineral

item.title: Strategic maturity without trumpets: How India held its nerve and rebalanced smartly
item.description: India’s recent conduct offers a quiet lesson in statecraft. When pushed, it did not lunge. When uncertain, it did not freeze. It absorbed pressure, adjusted where necessary, protected core interests, and waited. That patience has begun to pay dividends

item.title: The curious case of ‘missing’ Epstein files
item.description: The US Department of Justice will not release the remaining files, which could contain more serious allegations against rich and powerful men, as the hope for justice for Jeffrey Epstein victims fades
